intro: Tonningia capitata, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, compact growth habit and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or crevice habitats, adapting to poor soil conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with a distinctive lip that is often darker in color. Tonningia capitata is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on the surface of other plants without being parasitic.
